rdf:Description.dc:title: An Historical View of the Philippine Islands (Volume 1 of 2)
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Joaquín Martínez de Zúñiga (1760–1818)
John Maver
rdf:Description.dc:rights: This eBook is for the use of anyone anywhere at no cost and with almost no restrictions whatsoever. You may copy it, give it away or re-use it under the terms of the Project Gutenberg License included with this eBook or online at www.gutenberg.org. This eBook is produced by the Online Distributed Proofreading Team at www.pgdp.net. This is volume one of one of earliest histories of the Philippines in the English language, published in 1814 in London by J. Asperne, as a translation of Historia de las Islas Philipinas published near Manila at the Impreso en Sampaloc in 1803. The Spanish original is extremely rare. This book has been prepared from scans available from the Collection “The United States and its Territories” at the University of Michigan (1). Alternative scans are available from the Internet Archive (1). Volume II of this work is also available at Project Gutenberg.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Philippines -- History

Asperne, as a translation of “Historia de las Islas Philipinas” published near Manila at the Impreso en Sampaloc in 1803. The Spanish original is extremely rare.
